events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on May 9th, 2024, involving significant damage to the front bumper and windshield.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident as the damage reported involves the vehicle sustained during a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim to ensure swift processing and communication with the claimant.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps for vehicle damage assessment.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police accident report to support their auto claim.
Received the requested accident photos and police report, which provide comprehensive details of the car collision incident.
The investigation into the claim commencement included reviewing submitted documents and contacting involved parties for validation.
The investigation concluded that the damage was consistent with the reported collision and no policy exclusions apply.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair cost estimates and policy coverage limits for the damaged vehicle.
The customer responded with acceptance of the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the service provided.
Following customer approval, the claim was formally approved for payment and repair initiation.
Payment was successfully issued to the repair shop covering all authorized costs related to the vehicle damages.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and customer was fully reimbursed.
All claim files were archived securely for future reference and compliance with record retention policies.
